alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 8:34PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will keep the river flowing high and fast. Although impacts will lessen Monday into Tuesday, expect minor flooding to return by Wednesday morning downstream from Fresno dam. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River near Harlem. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flooding of culverts and some county bridges. 2,000 acres of irrigated land flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Sunday, the stage was 20.5 feet. - The river at this forecast point has fallen below flood stage, and it should continue falling during the day Monday. This will likely hinder additional flooding until it starts rising again Monday night, but impacts from earlier flooding will likely linger, such as standing water in fields. - Forecast...The river is forecast to continue falling to 19.9 feet by tomorrow evening. It then forecast to rise once again above flood stage Wednesday morning to a maximum stage of 22.1 feet Friday evening. It is then forecast to fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.4 feet on 05/22/1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Milk River Harlem 21.0 20.5 Sun 7 pm MDT 19.9 20.6 21.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1115 AM MDT.
